result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dalton B. Wierzba

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:04 pm 
INCLUDES 22CF290, 22CF316, 22CM149, & 22CM224. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears in person with Atty Dave Casey. 
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

PLEA: Not Guilty on Misd. files. 

COURT ORDERS: $2500 sig bond to cover all files - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): BMRK or SAM. 
- No possession of dangerous weapons. 
- No possession of drug paraphernalia. 
- Attend all scheduled school. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- Prints and photograph. 

BRANCH 3 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 5/3/2022 at 1:30 pm. 
Prelim: 6/24/2022 at 3:00 pm.

INCLUDES 22CF290, 22CF316, 22CM149, & 22CM224.   No contact with victim(s): BMRK or SAM. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No possession of dangerous weapons. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Attend all scheduled school. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  Prints and photograph.
